title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 ยง 330.1 - Application to practice psychology
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 ยง 330.1 - Application to practice psychology

State Regulations

Application by a duly licensed psychologist of the State of

New York to practice under the Workers' Compensation Law shall be made upon a
form furnished by the chair and shall be filed with the Psychology Practice

Committee, Workers' Compensation Board, Health Provider Administration, 100

Broadway-Menands, Albany, NY 12241. Such application shall state, fully and
truthfully, all the information required by law, and the applicant shall make
and sign the statutory agreement. The chair shall notify the psychologist of
approval of his or her application within 60 days after receipt by the chair of
a recommendation for approval from the Psychology Practice

Committee. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12
ยง
330.1

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
